Bug.Summery: Deleted extension point still exits after refresh package explorer

Lines.Line: 1. Select File->New->Plug-in Development->Plug-in Project from menu.
2. Enter a project name and then click Next button.
3. In the Plug-in Content Page, correct any missing strings and click Next
button.
4. On the templates page, select create a plug-in using one of the templates
checkbox and select Plug-in with Patterns item from the templates list view.
5. Click Next button and then click Finish button.
6. On Package Explorer view ,open the project node and right click plug-in.xml
and select Open With ->Plug-in Manifest Editor.
7. In Plug-in manifest editor select Extensions page, click Add button to add
two extension points test01 and test02.
8. Right click the test02 extension point and select Delete.
--> Problem: Refresh the Package Explorer view the deleted
extension point also exists.

Bug.Summery: Focus cannot be given to visible but zero-sized controls
Bug.WithStack:
Calling setFocus() on a Control which has not yet been given bounds fails on GTK+. This is due to part of the fix applied for bug 65053. It seems this part of the change may have been applied in error. I have reverted the change for RC2 in both Control and ToolItem. For reference, the offending code was:
if (!OS.GTK_WIDGET_VISIBLE (parent.topHandle ())) return false;
Bug.WithOutStack:
Calling setFocus() on a Control which has not yet been given bounds fails on GTK+. This is due to part of the fix applied for bug 65053. It seems this part of the change may have been applied in error. I have reverted the change for RC2 in both Control and ToolItem. For reference, the offending code was:
if (!OS.GTK_WIDGET_VISIBLE (parent.topHandle ())) return false;

"This package provides application programming interfaces for support for the specification of views within the workbench ." + the two "for" words aren't quite right + there's an extra space before the period I've changed it to: This package provides API for querying the installed views and their properties. Bug.Summery: validation framework is broken

Lines.Line: 1) The code mode moved to wst.validation is not ported to flexible projects or
components yet
2) The ValidatorManager.getValidattionTasks(IProject, int)
is unusable as there is no info on the 2nd argument (int type)
Perhaps this should be java.util.logging.Level

Bug.WithStack:
1) The code mode moved to wst.validation is not ported to flexible projects or components yet 2) The ValidatorManager.getValidattionTasks(IProject, int) is unusable as there is no info on the 2nd argument (int type) Perhaps this should be java.util.logging.Level
This need to be resolved in time for WebSphere AST beta. Just to clarify validation framework does not have dependency on flex projects or is flex project aware and works on IProjects directly. It is the responsiblity of individual validators to deal with component ahd flex projects. In ValidatorManager.getValidattionTasks(IProject, int) the int is severity of the validation marker. Check out the IMessage interface to get a valid list of Severities. Reopen the the defect is there are any other issues in this area as i do not see a defect here. Changed Version field given new release numbering.
closing verified defect Closing already verified defects

Bug.Summery: [Scanner Discovery] Inclusion not found (ethereal) on Linux
Bug.WithStack:
Using June 07 CDT Build w/Eclipse 3.1 RC1. Download ethereal from ethereal.com. Unzip and run configure. Import source code into project. Build w/per file scanner discovery on.
Find task in problem view: Severity Description Resource In Folder Location Creation Time 1 C/C++ Indexer Problem: Preprocessor Inclusion not found: cppmagic.h in file: on line: 0. syntax-tree.h Eth/ethereal-0.10.11/epan/dfilter line 27 June 2, 2005 1:22:28 AM
cppmagic is included from syntax-tree.h which is included in dfilter.c. dfilter.c is built with the following command from the makefile:
if /bin/sh ../../libtool --mode=compile --tag=CC gcc -DHAVE_CONFIG_H -I. -I. -I. ./.. -I./../.. -I./.. -I./../../tools/lemon -I/usr/local/include -DINET6 - D_U_="__attribute__((unused))" -Wall -W -g -O2 -I/usr/local/include -pthread - I/opt/gnome/include/gtk-2.0 -I/opt/gnome/lib/gtk-2.0/include -I/opt/gnome/ include/atk-1.0 -I/opt/gnome/include/pango-1.0 -I/usr/X11R6/include -I/usr/ include/freetype2 -I/opt/gnome/include/glib-2.0 -I/opt/gnome/lib/glib-2.0/ include -MT dfilter.lo -MD -MP -MF ".deps/dfilter.Tpo" -c -o dfilter.lo dfilter.c; \ then mv -f ".deps/dfilter.Tpo" ".deps/dfilter.Plo"; else rm -f ".deps/dfilter. Tpo"; exit 1; fi
The include path -I./../../tools/lemon is not being picked up properly. Downloaded ethereal-0.10.11 and tried this in CDT 6 and this now works.
I suggest marking as WORKSFORME. OK. Thanks. I'll mark as FIXED since we've done a huge number of changes that probably fixed this issue.
Bug.WithOutStack:
Using June 07 CDT Build w/Eclipse 3.1 RC1. Download ethereal from ethereal.com. Unzip and run configure. Import source code into project. Build w/per file scanner discovery on.
Find task in problem view: Severity Description Resource In Folder Location Creation Time 1 C/C++ Indexer Problem: Preprocessor Inclusion not found: cppmagic.h in file: on line: 0. syntax-tree.h Eth/ethereal-0.10.11/epan/dfilter line 27 June 2, 2005 1:22:28 AM
cppmagic is included from syntax-tree.h which is included in dfilter.c. dfilter.c is built with the following command from the makefile:
if /bin/sh ../../libtool --mode=compile --tag=CC gcc -DHAVE_CONFIG_H -I. -I. -I. ./.. -I./../.. -I./.. -I./../../tools/lemon -I/usr/local/include -DINET6 - D_U_="__attribute__((unused))" -Wall -W -g -O2 -I/usr/local/include -pthread - I/opt/gnome/include/gtk-2.0 -I/opt/gnome/lib/gtk-2.0/include -I/opt/gnome/ include/atk-1.0 -I/opt/gnome/include/pango-1.0 -I/usr/X11R6/include -I/usr/ include/freetype2 -I/opt/gnome/include/glib-2.0 -I/opt/gnome/lib/glib-2.0/ include -MT dfilter.lo -MD -MP -MF ".deps/dfilter.Tpo" -c -o dfilter.lo dfilter.c; \ then mv -f ".deps/dfilter.Tpo" ".deps/dfilter.Plo"; else rm -f ".deps/dfilter. Bug.Summery: EJBProjectResources not ported to artifact edits
Bug.WithStack:
It is blocking incremental state listeners. Bala, This class no longer makes any sense and really shouldnt' be ported or used. We could create a EJBComponentResource class but i don't see the need. This ProjectResource class had a bunch of nature api which obviously is no longer legit. It also had things like getEJBJar, etc...but that functionality can be found on the EJBArtifactEdit. If your looking for CommonArchive loading type api you can simply use the asEJBJarFile api on EJBArtifactEditUtilities (there are a bunch of other helper methods). If you need api outside of this let me know or open a defect requesting. Changed Version field given new release numbering.
We will stop using this class as Derek stated.
Bug.WithOutStack:
It is blocking incremental state listeners. Bala, This class no longer makes any sense and really shouldnt' be ported or used. We could create a EJBComponentResource class but i don't see the need. This ProjectResource class had a bunch of nature api which obviously is no longer legit. It also had things like getEJBJar, etc...but that functionality can be found on the EJBArtifactEdit. If your looking for CommonArchive loading type api you can simply use the asEJBJarFile api on EJBArtifactEditUtilities (there are a bunch of other helper methods). If you need api outside of this let me know or open a defect requesting. Changed Version field given new release numbering.
We will stop using this class as Derek stated.

Bug.Summery: NamespaceCollector needs to search whole tu
Bug.WithStack: namspaceCollector needs to search the whole tu for the namespace definitions because if you only search the node that contains the namespace you can miss pieces if that node is itself a namespace with multiple definitions. This has bad implications for namespaces distributed this way, we can get problem bindings due to a perceived ambiguity resulting, at the least in a CCE fixed
Bug.WithOutStack: namspaceCollector needs to search the whole tu for the namespace definitions because if you only search the node that contains the namespace you can miss pieces if that node is itself a namespace with multiple definitions. This has bad implications for namespaces distributed this way, we can get problem bindings due to a perceived ambiguity resulting, at the least in a CCE fixed

Bug.Summery: Style bit properties don't show for multiple selection
Bug.WithStack:
Drop multiple buttons onto a Composite. Select all the buttons. In the property sheet view, the BORDER and LINES properties don't show. They only show if you select one control at a time The best I can do at this time is to allow them to show up if all of the same type are selected, e.g. all are buttons. This is because the bits are defined at each class level. Unheroted styles do not show through as inherited, but instead as a copy. So we don't knoe=w that canvas border and button border are the same border style. To do this needs a change in how it is defined in beaninfo to idicate iherited.
The change has been released to HEAD. VE 1.1 is released. Moving to closed.
Bug.WithOutStack:
Drop multiple buttons onto a Composite. Select all the buttons. In the property sheet view, the BORDER and LINES properties don't show. They only show if you select one control at a time The best I can do at this time is to allow them to show up if all of the same type are selected, e.g. all are buttons. This is because the bits are defined at each class level. Unheroted styles do not show through as inherited, but instead as a copy. So we don't knoe=w that canvas border and button border are the same border style. To do this needs a change in how it is defined in beaninfo to idicate iherited.
The change has been released to HEAD. VE 1.1 is released. Moving to closed.

Bug.Summery: Enhancements to GEF/draw2d code

Lines.Line: - shows selection and focus feedback (primary or secondary)
- optionally underlines the label's text
- wraps the label's text at a given width with a given alignment
- supports multiple label icons
- The constructor takes an additional parameter which represents the ascending
or descending nature of the timer
- An additional method isFinished() allows the user to determine if the
duration has been exceeded

Bug.WithStack:
The following compilable units are based on Eclipse code and have been enhanced for further requirements:
ResizableCompartmentFigure is based on GEF's DrawerFigure class which is for palette functionality. The new class is used as a figure to represent the resizable compartment of a shape. It was also modified to allow subclassing. The code has not really been enhanced but modified to be used a different context.
DiagramGraphicalViewerKeyHandler is based on GEF's PaletteViewerKeyHandler. It was modified to allow for subclassing and enhanced to enter edit mode when an alphanumeric is entered. This is necessary to facilitate the user entry and eliminate unnecessary mouse clicks. Please refer to the keyPressed() and isAlphaNum() methods.
AnimatableScrollPane is based on GEF's DrawerFigure. The size calculation methods were modified to allow the resizable compartments to resize in a progressive, animated manner. The size calculation takes progress into consideration so that the resizing occurs in increments and does not directly change to the destined size.
OverlayScrollPaneLayout is based on GEF's OverlayScrollPaneLayout. The new class adds a calculateMinimumSize method which gets the minimum size from the viewport.
WrapLabel is based on GEF's Label. This class was enhanced with the following capabilities: - shows selection and focus feedback (primary or secondary) - optionally underlines the label's text - wraps the label's text at a given width with a given alignment - supports multiple label icons
AnimationModel is based on the draw2d AnimationModel - The constructor takes an additional parameter which represents the ascending or descending nature of the timer - An additional method isFinished() allows the user to determine if the duration has been exceeded
The attached package contains the aforementioned code. Created attachment 22553 Zip file with code To look at after R3.1 LATER and REMIND resolutions will be going away with the upgrade of Bugzilla to the latest Bugzilla 3.4. They are no longer part of the default Bugzilla installation. See http://dev.eclipse.org/mhonarc/lists/eclipse.org-committers/msg00778.html for the announcement.
As a result RESOLVED + REMIND OR LATER will be changed to RESOLVED + WONTFIX
This unfortunately also means I need to REOPEN and then RESOLVE as WONTFIX
Sorry for the inconvenience. LATER and REMIND resolutions will be going away with the upgrade of Bugzilla to the latest Bugzilla 3.4. They are no longer part of the default Bugzilla installation. See http://dev.eclipse.org/mhonarc/lists/eclipse.org-committers/msg00778.html for the announcement.
As a result RESOLVED + REMIND OR LATER will be changed to RESOLVED + WONTFIX
This unfortunately also means I need to REOPEN and then RESOLVE as WONTFIX
Sorry for the inconvenience.
Bug.WithOutStack:
The following compilable units are based on Eclipse code and have been enhanced for further requirements:
ResizableCompartmentFigure is based on GEF's DrawerFigure class which is for palette functionality. The new class is used as a figure to represent the resizable compartment of a shape. It was also modified to allow subclassing. The code has not really been enhanced but modified to be used a different context.
DiagramGraphicalViewerKeyHandler is based on GEF's PaletteViewerKeyHandler. It was modified to allow for subclassing and enhanced to enter edit mode when an alphanumeric is entered. This is necessary to facilitate the user entry and eliminate unnecessary mouse clicks. Please refer to the keyPressed() and isAlphaNum() methods.
AnimatableScrollPane is based on GEF's DrawerFigure. The size calculation methods were modified to allow the resizable compartments to resize in a progressive, animated manner. The size calculation takes progress into consideration so that the resizing occurs in increments and does not directly change to the destined size.
OverlayScrollPaneLayout is based on GEF's OverlayScrollPaneLayout. The new class adds a calculateMinimumSize method which gets the minimum size from the viewport.
WrapLabel is based on GEF's Label. This class was enhanced with the following capabilities: - shows selection and focus feedback (primary or secondary) - optionally underlines the label's text - wraps the label's text at a given width with a given alignment - supports multiple label icons
AnimationModel is based on the draw2d AnimationModel - The constructor takes an additional parameter which represents the ascending or descending nature of the timer - An additional method isFinished() allows the user to determine if the duration has been exceeded
The attached package contains the aforementioned code. Created attachment 22553 Zip file with code To look at after R3.1 LATER and REMIND resolutions will be going away with the upgrade of Bugzilla to the latest Bugzilla 3.4. They are no longer part of the default Bugzilla installation. See http://dev.eclipse.org/mhonarc/lists/eclipse.org-committers/msg00778.html for the announcement.
As a result RESOLVED + REMIND OR LATER will be changed to RESOLVED + WONTFIX
This unfortunately also means I need to REOPEN and then RESOLVE as WONTFIX

As a result RESOLVED + REMIND OR LATER will be changed to RESOLVED + WONTFIX
This unfortunately also means I need to REOPEN and then RESOLVE as WONTFIX
Sorry for the inconvenience.

Bug.Summery: [PerspectiveBar] [FastViews] [Progress] Need help topics for workbench side bars

Lines.Line: - the shortcut bar was split into the perspective bar and fast view bar in 3.0,
so there's no point mentioning "shortcut bar" anymore
- the screen shot of the perspective bar is obscured by the popup menus
- the screen shot of the fast view bar is obscured by the drag rectangle
- the text should explicitly describe the context menus and their items, or at
least mention the context menu rather than just including it in the screen shot

Bug.WithStack:
3.1 RC1
While looking at adding context help to the menu items on the perspective bar (bug 90026), I realized that we don't currently have any help topics in the user doc discussing the perspective bar itself.
It would be good to add a section describing the perspective bar. For organization, it could either go in the existing perspectives overview, or in its own section (like we do for the menus). The latter probably makes more sense.
We should also do likewise for the fast view bar and progress bar. These topics could then be referred to from workbench overview topic describing the overall window layout. When there is a topic for the perspective bar, should fix up the context help being added in bug 90026 to refer to it.
Created attachment 22570 two htm files for "dockOn" and "show text" seperately
Apply from: org.eclipse.platfrom.doc.user/tasks This patch creates two htm files: tasks-10a.htm and tasks-10b.htm
Andre, please feel free to make corrections for them. Turns out we already have such a page: org.eclipse.platform.doc.user/reference/ref-3.htm
Could use some improvements here: - the shortcut bar was split into the perspective bar and fast view bar in 3.0, so there's no point mentioning "shortcut bar" anymore - the screen shot of the perspective bar is obscured by the popup menus - the screen shot of the fast view bar is obscured by the drag rectangle - the text should explicitly describe the context menus and their items, or at least mention the context menu rather than just including it in the screen shot
I don't think separate help topics are needed for the individual actions. I think the existing topic will suffice, with some cleanup.
I'll change the context help in bug 90026 to refer to the existing topic, as "Perspective Bar".
I can't agree more for using existing pages. I'll work with Andrea tommorow for finishing it. I have split "Shorcut Bar"(ref-3.htm) into two new docs. "Perspective Bar" (ref-3.htm)and "Fast View Bar" (ref-3a.htm). I have replaced the screenshots and with Shujie's help I have made the improvements suggested in Comment #3.
All I need now is some info for "Progress"...Nick?
Thanks,
AC Tod, can you help Andrea with a topic for the progress indicator?

Bug.WithStack:
eclipse 3.0.2; emf 2.0.3; gef 3.1.0 created a new report project and switched to the birt perspective. this step worked fine. but when i try to create a new report, i get the following error message: !MESSAGE Problems occurred when invoking code from plug-in: "org.eclipse.core.runtime". !STACK 0 java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/eclipse/gef/commands/CommandStack
(for details see the attached eclipse errorlog.) after that i tried the same installation with eclipse 3.0.1, but i got the same errors. i followed the proceedings of "installing birt/common problems" (eclipse -clean, etc.), but i still get the same error. Created attachment 22554 eclipse error log (eclipse 3.0.2)
i get this exception every time i try to create a new report or open an existing report. Do you still get this problem? That looks a install problem of you eclipse/GEF plugin. Please visit http://www.eclipse.org/birt/index.php?page=build/install.html get installation guide. Could you try to install a clean eclipse and test again? Thanks

Bug.Summery: RetargetActions are not being disposed
Bug.WithStack:
anywhere that a RetargetAction is instantiated and used, it must be disposed at some point.
For example, LogicActionBarContributor.buildActions() Fixed and released to HEAD.
I've changed ActionBarContributor#dispose() so that it disposes the RetargetActions. Randy, the reason you reproduced this bug is because RC1 (or whatever build you're using) doesn't have the fix in bug 96722.
Bug.WithOutStack:
anywhere that a RetargetAction is instantiated and used, it must be disposed at some point.
For example, LogicActionBarContributor.buildActions() Fixed and released to HEAD.
I've changed ActionBarContributor#dispose() so that it disposes the RetargetActions. Randy, the reason you reproduced this bug is because RC1 (or whatever build you're using) doesn't have the fix in bug 96722.

Bug.Summery: Focus listener is not required for CellEditorManager
Bug.WithStack: CellEditors started firing apply value when they lose focus. So the workaround in CellEditorManager to add a focus listener is no longer required. The workaround prevented dialog cell editors from functioning the right way. fixed.
Bug.WithOutStack: CellEditors started firing apply value when they lose focus. So the workaround in CellEditorManager to add a focus listener is no longer required. The workaround prevented dialog cell editors from functioning the right way. fixed.

Bug.Summery: [Undo] - Undo/redo toolbar items
Bug.WithStack:
From the original 3.1 undo proposal:
Undo and Redo on the toolbar should include a drop down that shows the operation history. This history depends on the current parts context.
operationHistory.getUndoHistoryFor(myContext);
The drop down permits range selection of operations from the top down (see MS Word and other applications). This UI implies a linear undo within any particular set of contexts. While the selection of a range of undo operations is not considered that valuable, the ability to see the history is considered valuable.
- This feature was deferred in 3.1 but was never captured in a bug report. As per http://wiki.eclipse.org/Platform_UI/Bug_Triage_Change_2009
Bug.WithOutStack:
From the original 3.1 undo proposal:
Undo and Redo on the toolbar should include a drop down that shows the operation history. This history depends on the current parts context.
operationHistory.getUndoHistoryFor(myContext);
The drop down permits range selection of operations from the top down (see MS Word and other applications). This UI implies a linear undo within any particular set of contexts. While the selection of a range of undo operations is not considered that valuable, the ability to see the history is considered valuable.
- This feature was deferred in 3.1 but was never captured in a bug report. As per http://wiki.eclipse.org/Platform_UI/Bug_Triage_Change_2009

Bug.Summery: [Viewers] Spotlight/Preference searching has spoiled me
Bug.WithStack:
It would be nice if we could push the search functionality offered by the preference tree down into a reusable JFace viewer. After using the search features in spotlight I find myself wanting to just type search criteria into any tree I see in eclipse and have it find the items I'm looking for. We have a good start on that already in the preferences, it just needs to be elaborated on and exposed. What is wrong with the FilteredTree? Well, currently it's internal and it takes up a lot of space... perhaps if the search combo could be collapsed somehow. Also, the behaviour on very large trees would need to be negotiated - as it is, it expands the entire model internally. [since this (really useful enhancement) is not Mac specific, I'm changing Hardware/OS to All] Marking this as a dup of bug 74795.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 74795 ***

It would be nice if we could push the search functionality offered by the preference tree down into a reusable JFace viewer. Well, currently it's internal and it takes up a lot of space... perhaps if the search combo could be collapsed somehow. Also, the behaviour on very large trees would need to be negotiated - as it is, it expands the entire model internally. Bug.Summery: Set font on CLabel doesn't apply it in the remote VM
Bug.WithStack:
Drop a Label and CLabel. Select both and change the font property to something other than the default. The Label font changes but the CLabel doesn't. Running the app shows the correct font. Added code to ImageCapture to set the GC's font based on the Control's font. For some reason, CLabel doesn't do this whereas other controls do.
Committed to HEAD for 1.1M2 VE 1.1. releaased. close bug.
Bug.WithOutStack:
Drop a Label and CLabel. Select both and change the font property to something other than the default. The Label font changes but the CLabel doesn't. Running the app shows the correct font. Committed to HEAD for 1.1M2 VE 1.1. releaased. close bug.

Bug.Summery: It's not a Web module if it's not targetted to a server?
Bug.WithStack:
I have been trying to programmatically create a Web module in a JUnit test. The project was created ok, but it was not recognized as a Web module from the Web module factory. When I dug down into the code, it turns out that the WebDeployableFactory says that a Web module doesn't exist unless it has a runtime target:
protected boolean isValidModule(IProject project) { if (isFlexableProject(project)) { IProjectProperties properties = ServerCore.getProjectProperties(project); if (properties != null && properties.getRuntimeTarget() != null && properties.getRuntimeTarget().getRuntimeType().getModuleTypes() != null) { IModuleType[] moduleTypes = properties.getRuntimeTarget().getRuntimeType().getModuleTypes(); ...
A Web module should exist as soon as the project & resources are created. Just because the module isn't currently targetted to a runtime shouldn't make it 'disappear'. Tim, I will now return true if the given project contains a module of the given type (ie for Web is there is a web component in the project i will return true) otherwise false... Is this the only change you are looking for? Yup, sounds good. Change released for web, ejb and ear...those are the only ones implemented at this point...let me know if you want or are ready for rar and app client Hi Derek. Thanks for the quick fix! No rush on rar or app client, but please make sure that this change gets applied there or doesn't get lost. Thanks again. Verified.
Bug.WithOutStack:
I have been trying to programmatically create a Web module in a JUnit test. The project was created ok, but it was not recognized as a Web module from the Web module factory. When I dug down into the code, it turns out that the WebDeployableFactory says that a Web module doesn't exist unless it has a runtime target:
protected boolean isValidModule(IProject project) { if (isFlexableProject(project)) { IProjectProperties properties = ServerCore.getProjectProperties(project); if (properties != null && properties.getRuntimeTarget() != null && properties.getRuntimeTarget().getRuntimeType().getModuleTypes() != null) { IModuleType[] moduleTypes = properties.getRuntimeTarget().getRuntimeType().getModuleTypes(); ...
A Web module should exist as soon as the project & resources are created. Just because the module isn't currently targetted to a runtime shouldn't make it 'disappear'. Tim, I will now return true if the given project contains a module of the given type (ie for Web is there is a web component in the project i will return true) otherwise false... Is this the only change you are looking for? Yup, sounds good. Change released for web, ejb and ear...those are the only ones implemented at this point...let me know if you want or are ready for rar and app client Hi Derek. Thanks for the quick fix! No rush on rar or app client, but please make sure that this change gets applied there or doesn't get lost. Thanks again. Verified.

Bug.Summery: OSGi classloading and fragments TCKs fail
Bug.WithStack:
There are a number of install time checks that need to be performed for Eclipse to pass the classloading and TCK testcases.
See the OSGi issue tracker for more info. The following issues require fixes in Eclipse:
341 RI should not allow extension bundles to declare import package headers 343 RI should not allow extension bundles to declare native code headers 345 RI should now allow extension bundles to declare require bundle headers. 347 RI does not fail to install a bundle which declares imports for java.* 351 A bundle with manifest version 2 must fail to install when the manifest does not specify the bundle symbolic name 355 A bundle with different values for version and specification-version must fail to install 356 A bundle must fail to install if it specifies bundle-symbolic-name and bundle-version (as directives) in Export-Package 359 A bundle must fail to install if it imports a package more than once 361 A bundle must fail to install when the Bundle-ManifestVersion value is greater than 2 362 A bundle must fail to install when the manifest has a duplicate directive 370 When a package is re-exported the uses directive cannot be redefined The following issues should already be fixed in Eclipse 3.1:
341 RI should not allow extension bundles to declare import package headers 343 RI should not allow extension bundles to declare native code headers 345 RI should now allow extension bundles to declare require bundle headers.
At the call today CPEG agreed to remove the TCK test for the following issue so that the TCK will pass on future frameworks:
361 A bundle must fail to install when the Bundle-ManifestVersion value is greater than 2
But we "should" still implement this to be complete. Created attachment 22655 Proposed fix Pascal and Rafael, can you please review this patch from Jennifer? I have already reviewed the patch.
Jeff, after everyone approves the patch, do you approve release for RC2? Patch reviewed. It is good. Some comments have been made to Tom on the code structure, nothing critical. +1 Patch released with some modifications suggested by Pascal.

341 RI should not allow extension bundles to declare import package headers 343 RI should not allow extension bundles to declare native code headers 345 RI should now allow extension bundles to declare require bundle headers.

Bug.Summery: AdapterManager.getAdapter(Object, String, boolean) does not check supertypes
Bug.WithStack:
build N20050607
While tracing through the patch for bug 97780, I noticed that AdapterManager.getAdapter(Object, String, boolean) checks type name equality:
if (result == null && adaptable.getClass().getName().equals(adapterType))
whereas getAdapter(Object, Class) does an instanceof check at this point: if (result == null && adapterType.isInstance(adaptable))
For the first case, there's enough info to do a full supertype check, by recursing over the superclasses and interfaces if the adaptable, and comparing their names with the given string.
The list of all supertypes could be cached for performance.
Not sure if this is desired or not here, but it seems strange that it would only check the type of the object and not supertypes. Yes, we could do better in this case. In fact, we already compute and maintain a a cache of Class -> Supertype list, and the cache is likely to be already primed with that class at this point in the code.
I think this wasn't added because that entire clause is really a "bonus" check that was never really the intended purpose of getAdapter(). I.e., if you call getAdapter() on a class that already implements that interface, we return the class itself if there are no factories that will perform the transformation.
We could consider doing better here in 3.2. There hasn't been a compelling need for this. Closing.
Bug.WithOutStack:
build N20050607
While tracing through the patch for bug 97780, I noticed that AdapterManager.getAdapter(Object, String, boolean) checks type name equality:
if (result == null && adaptable.getClass().getName().equals(adapterType))
whereas getAdapter(Object, Class) does an instanceof check at this point: if (result == null && adapterType.isInstance(adaptable))
For the first case, there's enough info to do a full supertype check, by recursing over the superclasses and interfaces if the adaptable, and comparing their names with the given string.
The list of all supertypes could be cached for performance.
Not sure if this is desired or not here, but it seems strange that it would only check the type of the object and not supertypes. Yes, we could do better in this case. In fact, we already compute and maintain a a cache of Class -> Supertype list, and the cache is likely to be already primed with that class at this point in the code.
I think this wasn't added because that entire clause is really a "bonus" check that was never really the intended purpose of getAdapter(). I.e., if you call getAdapter() on a class that already implements that interface, we return the class itself if there are no factories that will perform the transformation.
We could consider doing better here in 3.2. There hasn't been a compelling need for this. Closing.

Bug.Summery: [RC1] Refactor Move package does not update Exported Packages in manifest

Lines.Line: 1) Manually remove all references to the package in the moved-from project
manifest. This is the bug part. Refactor causes an error.
2) Manually add an export of the package to the moved-to project manifest (if it
was exported in the moved-from project).
3) Manually add a dependency to the moved-to project to all plug-ins that refer
to the package (except the moved-to project) (if they do not already have such a
dependency).

Bug.WithStack:
The result of such a move from one plug-in to another is that the moved-from project manifest acquires an error and all users of the package outside the moved-to plug-in acquire errors. As a result, the user has to:
1) Manually remove all references to the package in the moved-from project manifest. This is the bug part. Refactor causes an error.
2) Manually add an export of the package to the moved-to project manifest (if it was exported in the moved-from project).
3) Manually add a dependency to the moved-to project to all plug-ins that refer to the package (except the moved-to project) (if they do not already have such a dependency).
Move package should at least offer options to do these things. (1) should be done in any event. The description of this bug should to changed to emphasize that the 'Export-Package' header value of the Manifest.mf simply doesn't get updated if the package structure changes (add/removed/modify/refactor).
Applying the encouraged way of describing a plugin by means of splitting the plugin.xml into plugin.xml and Manifest.mf to an existing plugin results into an annoying inconvenience that the 'plugin.xml only' plugin manifest did not have: the plugin.xml runtime/export tags allow to specify '*' for exporting all packages.
For what ever reasons the OSGi specification doesn't allow to use wildcards, so we need PDE support here.
agree that we should look at having an option on a plugin project to say "I intend to export all packages". Users woudl then get a warning if their export list does not include all packages.
Either wway, there should be a warning (perhaps there is) if a plugin exports packages that it does not have or get from somewhere else. #1 and #2 as outlined in comment 0 are now done automatically by PDE. The Export-Package for the originating/destination manifest.mf get updated after a package move.
#3 is a good suggestion and will be done soon.
As for the lack of export * in a manifest.mf, this is a separate issue that will be addressed in bug 82819.
so #1 and #2 from comment 0 were done a while back.
#3 would be too aggressive for refactoring, where we are expected to be 100% sure of what the user wants. Messing with the Require-Bundle header is questionable in this case.
What I have done now however, is that if all plug-ins that had depended on a package via Import-Package, they would be updated when a package gets renamed. Works pretty nicely.
Bug.WithOutStack:
The result of such a move from one plug-in to another is that the moved-from project manifest acquires an error and all users of the package outside the moved-to plug-in acquire errors. As a result, the user has to:
1) Manually remove all references to the package in the moved-from project manifest. This is the bug part. Refactor causes an error.
2) Manually add an export of the package to the moved-to project manifest (if it was exported in the moved-from project).
3) Manually add a dependency to the moved-to project to all plug-ins that refer to the package (except the moved-to project) (if they do not already have such a dependency).
Move package should at least offer options to do these things. (1) should be done in any event. The description of this bug should to changed to emphasize that the 'Export-Package' header value of the Manifest.mf simply doesn't get updated if the package structure changes (add/removed/modify/refactor).
Applying the encouraged way of describing a plugin by means of splitting the plugin.xml into plugin.xml and Manifest.mf to an existing plugin results into an annoying inconvenience that the 'plugin.xml only' plugin manifest did not have: the plugin.xml runtime/export tags allow to specify '*' for exporting all packages.
For what ever reasons the OSGi specification doesn't allow to use wildcards, so we need PDE support here.
agree that we should look at having an option on a plugin project to say "I intend to export all packages". Users woudl then get a warning if their export list does not include all packages.
Either wway, there should be a warning (perhaps there is) if a plugin exports packages that it does not have or get from somewhere else. #1 and #2 as outlined in comment 0 are now done automatically by PDE. The Export-Package for the originating/destination manifest.mf get updated after a package move.
#3 is a good suggestion and will be done soon.
As for the lack of export * in a manifest.mf, this is a separate issue that will be addressed in bug 82819.
so #1 and #2 from comment 0 were done a while back.
#3 would be too aggressive for refactoring, where we are expected to be 100% sure of what the user wants. Messing with the Require-Bundle header is questionable in this case.
What I have done now however, is that if all plug-ins that had depended on a package via Import-Package, they would be updated when a package gets renamed. Works pretty nicely.

Bug.Summery: Tree.showItem should check for a visible count of 0
Bug.WithStack: The method showItem in the Tree class does not check to see if the visible count is 0. If nothing is visible, then this will result in the selected item being the top most item even if there are items above it. If nothing is visible then there is no need to set a top item. Created attachment 22569 This is a patch that adds a check to see if any items in a tree are visible Not sure about this. When no items are visible, you still can set the top item. GG to evaluate the patch. Well your in a call to show item, which I believe is meant to move the tree to the the item and shift everything upward if only that particular item is visible. What is happening on QNX is that showItem gets called before the Tree gets properly sized, so the visibleItemsCount is set to zero because the tree is reported as being one pixel big. It sets the top most item to the currently selected item in the tree due to the current logic in showItem. This causes problems for any tree that saves the last selected item. For example, the preferences page. The first time you open the preference page during a session you are fine because the top most item is the currently selected one. However, if java is selected, and you close the preference page, then reopen it, Java is now the top most item and none of the items above it can be seen. You can still use the up arrow to get to them ( it doesn't actually show them until you close the preference page and then reopen it ). Also, there is already code in showItem to determine if you need to set the topItem. I realize that a visibleItemCount of 0 is probably a very special case, but it happens in Photon. Closing report, platform is discontinued.

Created attachment 22569 This is a patch that adds a check to see if any items in a tree are visible Not sure about this. When no items are visible, you still can set the top item. GG to evaluate the patch. Well your in a call to show item, which I believe is meant to move the tree to the the item and shift everything upward if only that particular item is visible. What is happening on QNX is that showItem gets called before the Tree gets properly sized, so the visibleItemsCount is set to zero because the tree is reported as being one pixel big. It sets the top most item to the currently selected item in the tree due to the current logic in showItem. This causes problems for any tree that saves the last selected item. For example, the preferences page. The first time you open the preference page during a session you are fine because the top most item is the currently selected one. However, if java is selected, and you close the preference page, then reopen it, Java is now the top most item and none of the items above it can be seen. You can still use the up arrow to get to them ( it doesn't actually show them until you close the preference page and then reopen it ). Also, there is already code in showItem to determine if you need to set the topItem. I realize that a visibleItemCount of 0 is probably a very special case, but it happens in Photon. Closing report, platform is discontinued.

Bug.Summery: Delete eclipse/configuration folder destroys eclipse environment
Bug.WithStack:
With IES 3.0 when the eclipse environment got into a bad state folks will often delete workspace and eclipse/configuration folder.
With IES 3.1 deleting the configuration folder causes the eclipse environment to be destroyed so that the platform can no longer load.
Specifically it is the removal of the config.ini file within the configuration folder that is causing the problem.
A stack trace is generated: !SESSION 2005-06-02 16:24:59.851 ----------------------------------------------- eclipse.buildId=unknown java.fullversion=J2RE 1.4.2 IBM J9 2.2 Windows XP x86-32 j9n142sr1a-20050209 (JIT enabled) J9VM - 20050124_1708_lHdSMR JIT - r7_level20050120_1805 BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=en_US Command-line arguments: -os win32 -ws win32 -arch x86 -consolelog
!ENTRY org.eclipse.osgi 2005-06-02 16:25:00.652 !MESSAGE Application error !STACK 1 java.lang.IllegalStateException: Unable to acquire application service. at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run (EclipseStarter.java:362) at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run (EclipseStarter.java:160) at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method) at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke (NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:85) at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke (NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:58) at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke (DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:60) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:391) at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.invokeFramework(Main.java:330) at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:274) at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:977) at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:952) This has been changed in M5 and has been published in the new and noteworthy:
Don't delete config.ini
After modifying an Eclipse install by means other than the Eclipse Update manager (e.g., after unzipping a new plug-in or feature into your Eclipse install directory, the next time you restart Eclipse you need to use the -clean option to ensure that the changes are noticed and picked up.
Note: In the past, some people accomplished the desired outcome by deleting the configuration folder in the install directory. This is no longer possible because the config.ini file in that directory contains vital irreplaceable information. If you still prefer mucking with the configuration directory instead of using -clean, you should delete the inner folders but leave config.ini alone.
Bug.WithOutStack:
With IES 3.0 when the eclipse environment got into a bad state folks will often delete workspace and eclipse/configuration folder.
With IES 3.1 deleting the configuration folder causes the eclipse environment to be destroyed so that the platform can no longer load.
Specifically it is the removal of the config.ini file within the configuration folder that is causing the problem.
A stack trace is generated: !SESSION 2005-06-02 16:24:59.851 ----------------------------------------------- eclipse.buildId=unknown java.fullversion=J2RE 1.4.2 IBM J9 2.2 Windows XP x86-32 j9n142sr1a-20050209 (JIT enabled) J9VM - 20050124_1708_lHdSMR JIT - r7_level20050120_1805 BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=en_US Command-line arguments: -os win32 -ws win32 -arch x86 -consolelog
!ENTRY org.eclipse.osgi 2005-06-02 16:25:00.652 !MESSAGE Application error !STACK 1
This has been changed in M5 and has been published in the new and noteworthy:
Don't delete config.ini
After modifying an Eclipse install by means other than the Eclipse Update manager (e.g., after unzipping a new plug-in or feature into your Eclipse install directory, the next time you restart Eclipse you need to use the -clean option to ensure that the changes are noticed and picked up.
Note: In the past, some people accomplished the desired outcome by deleting the configuration folder in the install directory. This is no longer possible because the config.ini file in that directory contains vital irreplaceable information. If you still prefer mucking with the configuration directory instead of using -clean, you should delete the inner folders but leave config.ini alone.

Bug.Summery: Refactor utility classes (needed by WST) from JST to WST
Bug.WithStack:
There are a number of utility and similar classes currently in JST that provide non-JST specific function (ie. could be moved to WST) and/or that were needed by WST component plugins and have been cloned to WST (ie. need to be removed, and have callers redirected to their replacements in WST). Some of these are tagged by "TODO"s in the Java source.
Note: This item is open ended. There are a fairly small number of classes that need to be refactored from JST to WST, and a much, much larger number that could be refactored (such as the extensible wizards themselves). This requirement is meant only to tackle the small number of "need to refactor" classes. Internal tweakage. Not required in 0.7. Deferred. Kathy, for the moment, I'm clearing the target on this enhancement on the premise that all the utility classes we might use are for internal use by the Web services platform and do not need to be moved for WTP 1.0. If there are any utility classes that should be public, we'll handle them under one of the enhancements we have for defining the public API for the Web services platform. Internal code clean up. Some utility classes had been refactored already. Separate defects would be opened to handle specific cases that's still remaining. Fair 'nuff. Closed.

Some of these are tagged by "TODO"s in the Java source.

Bug.Summery: @model problems in operations
Bug.WithStack:
A couple of problems with @model tags in new support for operation type multiplicity:
Operations that with getter-like signatures should be identified by a parameters="" property in their @model tag, not parameters="-"
Operations that are not multiplicity-many, but that do return a list type, are properly marked many="false"; however, their type is not correctly handled on reload. The fix is in CVS. Fixed in 2.1.0 I200506091102 Move to verified as per bug 206558.
Bug.WithOutStack:
A couple of problems with @model tags in new support for operation type multiplicity:
Operations that with getter-like signatures should be identified by a parameters="" property in their @model tag, not parameters="-"
Operations that are not multiplicity-many, but that do return a list type, are properly marked many="false"; however, their type is not correctly handled on reload. The fix is in CVS. Fixed in 2.1.0 I200506091102 Move to verified as per bug 206558.

Bug.Summery: Support nillable elements in the Web Services Explorer
Bug.WithStack:
The Web Services Explorer does not support nillable elements in its request and response message form views. The only way for a user to indicate or detect that an element is nil (eg. <shipDate xsi:nil="true"/>) is to use the source views. The form view should provide "Nil?" checkboxes for Schema elements specified with the nillable="true" attribute. This enhancement didn't make it into M5. Gil says that he will get it into M6. Bumping up the severity on this enhancement to major, since a customer needs this functionality in version 0.7 Last two comments were by Peter, in my absence. This defect is an enhancement to the WSE. It is not specifically required in WTP 0.7, and there are other true defects that need our attention in the dying days of 0.7. It should suffice to deliver this enhancement in WTP 1.0. This is entwined with enhancement bug 98844. Targetting M10.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 98844 *** Closed as duplicate. Closed as duplicate.

Bumping up the severity on this enhancement to major, since a customer needs this functionality in version 0.7 Last two comments were by Peter, in my absence. This defect is an enhancement to the WSE. It is not specifically required in WTP 0.7, and there are other true defects that need our attention in the dying days of 0.7. It should suffice to deliver this enhancement in WTP 1.0. This is entwined with enhancement bug 98844. Targetting M10.

Bug.Summery: Support attributes and nillable elements in the Web Services Explorer
Bug.WithStack:
The Web Services Explorer does not support attributes or attributeGroups in its request and response message form views. The only way for a user to enter or view attributes (eg. <purchaseOrder orderDate="1999-10-20">) is to use the source views. The form view should render fields for attributes in much the same fashion as it does for complex content elements. This enhancement didn't make it into M5. Gil indicated that it will be completed in M6. Bumping up the severity on this enhancement to major, since a customer needs this functionality in version 0.7 Targetting to M10. This is a fairly major omission from the WSE's support for Schema. Also, most of the work has been done. Deferring enhancements to WTP 1.5 per the memo "Achieving WTP 1.0 Quality Targets" by Arthur Ryman [1].
[1] http://dev.eclipse.org/mhonarc/lists/wtp-dev/msg02831.html Updated summary to include support for nillable elements. *** Bug 98843 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** changing target from 1.5 M1 to 1.5 M5 to reflect new numbering system as we join Collisto. *** Bug 102187 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** M5 is drawing too close (to be declared in just over a week - 3/3) to put any significant changes into the WSE. Retargetting to M6. Created attachment 37229 contains changes to explorer
I have moved the changes that were in rad 6 regarding Nils and attributes into wtp. There was some differences in how I accessed attributes in the xsd model. I have accounted for this and tested the WSE using significant tests from firemans fund which originaly showed the need for the change. This attachment is ready for review Thanks Gil. Patch reviewed and committed (less a couple dead methods / code fragments and an unnecessary change to build-war-pde.xml).
Kathy, please release this later today along with other committed fixes. Thanks - CB. Released to WTP 1.5 as v200604052251. Verified in M6. Closed.

Bug.Summery: Eclipse 3.1 M7 unstable with GTK+ 2.6.7
Bug.WithStack:
Eclipse 3.1 M7 seems to be very unstable with GTK+ 2.6.7. Eclipse crashes nearly every time when a view is scrolled horizontally. Sometimes crashes occur when opening a open file dialog; sometimes elsewhere. Many crashes are seemingly random and such crashes are very frequent. The crashes do not seem to be related to any specific theme engine - the crashes occur also using the default theme/icon set. With GTK+ 2.4.14 there are no problems so putting a GTK+ 2.4.14 installation in LD_LIBRARY_PATH before running Eclipse helps.
Eclipse is the prebuilt version from http://www.eclipse.org/downloads/download.php?file=/eclipse/downloads/drops/S-3.1M7-200505131415/eclipse-SDK-3.1M7-linux-gtk.tar.gz and everything else is built from sources with GCC 3.4.4. The system is running Glibc 2.3.4, Linux 2.6.11.5-mh2, GNOME 2.10.1, X.org 6.8.2. Created attachment 22572 Crash log Created attachment 22573 Another crash log This sounds a lot like the problem I was debugging for bug 79618. Do you happen to have used "-O3 -march=pentium4" or something similar when you compiled GTK+? Yes, in fact I do. :) I've built it with CFLAGS=-O3 -march=pentium4 -fomit-frame-pointer -funroll-loops. Try adding -mno-sse2 to the build of GTK+ and see if the crashes stop. At this point I am pretty convinced this is a duplicate of bug 79618. We are getting closer to figuring it out too. See this gcc bug for more information:
http://gcc.gnu.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=21973
If you could run using the Sun 1.5 VM the crash logs would be useful as they have more information, and it would confirm what's going on even further. Also, if the crashes stop if you recompile GTK+ with -mno-sse2 then this will also confirm it. Created attachment 22733 Crash log with JDK 1.5.0_03 Thanks, this is the same crash as referred to in the gcc bug. Recompiling GTK+ with "-mno-sse2" should work around the problem.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 79618 ***

Bug.Summery: jsp styles preference page background label for jsp content should be enabled
Bug.WithStack:
currently, on the jsp styles preference page, if the selected Content type is JSP Content, the Background color button is enabled, but the Background label is not. The Background label should be enabled as well. Phil, looks like in JSPStyledTextColorPicker#activate
you should have: fBackgroundLabel.setEnabled(true);
instead of fBackgroundLabel.setEnabled(false);
Changed Version field given new release numbering.
The button colors are also not changing to reflect the settings in JSP Content Created attachment 24236 o.e.j.jsp.ui.internal.preferences.ui.JSPStyledTextColorPicker.patch

I found a better solution that will fix both the problem I mentioned and Nitin's. Bug.Summery: [find/replace] Incremental search case sensitive not undone

Lines.Line: 1. Make a file with the word "Test" in it 2 times. For example:
"This is a Test of my Test."
2. Hit <ctrl>-j and type "tes" it should find the first Test.
3. now type 'T' so you are searching for tesT. It should find nothing.
4. now type backspace (perhaps a few times) until the 'T' is deleted.
5. The search is now searching for "tes" but it doesn't find anything, but it
should.

Bug.WithStack:
The incremental search (ctrl+j) automatically switches into case sensitive mode when a capital letter is typed. However if that capital letter is undone with a backspace, the search is still case sensitive. The search has to be canceled and started again to switch back to case insensitive mode.
Emacs has a similar automatic case senstive incremenatl search, however it removes the case sensitivity when the capital letter is removed. Works for me using N20050607-0010. See also: http://dev.eclipse.org/viewcvs/index.cgi/%7Echeckout%7E/platform-text-home/development/bug-incomplete.htm I just tested this again with build: I20050527-1300 (3.1RC1) Let me try to describe it better.
1. Make a file with the word "Test" in it 2 times. For example: "This is a Test of my Test." 2. Hit <ctrl>-j and type "tes" it should find the first Test. 3. now type 'T' so you are searching for tesT. It should find nothing. 4. now type backspace (perhaps a few times) until the 'T' is deleted. 5. The search is now searching for "tes" but it doesn't find anything, but it should.
My theory is that when the capital T is typed the case sensitivity is enabled but when the T is deleted that case sensitivity is not disabled. You're right. I must have tried a wrong scenario Fixed in HEAD. Available in builds > N20070226-0010.
Bug.WithOutStack:
The incremental search (ctrl+j) automatically switches into case sensitive mode when a capital letter is typed. However if that capital letter is undone with a backspace, the search is still case sensitive. The search has to be canceled and started again to switch back to case insensitive mode.
Emacs has a similar automatic case senstive incremenatl search, however it removes the case sensitivity when the capital letter is removed. Works for me using N20050607-0010. See also: http://dev.eclipse.org/viewcvs/index.cgi/%7Echeckout%7E/platform-text-home/development/bug-incomplete.htm I just tested this again with build: I20050527-1300 (3.1RC1) Let me try to describe it better.
1. Make a file with the word "Test" in it 2 times. For example: "This is a Test of my Test." 2. Hit <ctrl>-j and type "tes" it should find the first Test. 3. now type 'T' so you are searching for tesT. It should find nothing. 4. now type backspace (perhaps a few times) until the 'T' is deleted. 5. The search is now searching for "tes" but it doesn't find anything, but it should.
My theory is that when the capital T is typed the case sensitivity is enabled but when the T is deleted that case sensitivity is not disabled. You're right. I must have tried a wrong scenario Fixed in HEAD. Available in builds > N20070226-0010.

Bug.Summery: Dependency problems not reported in releng style mode
Bug.WithStack: In releng style mode the problems in the pde build states are not reported which makes the debugging of build problem impossible. Given that some teams are stuck with that and that the fix is more than trivial, I went ahead and released it. DJ, please review the change and let me know if you want me to back it out of rc2. +1
Bug.WithOutStack: In releng style mode the problems in the pde build states are not reported which makes the debugging of build problem impossible. Given that some teams are stuck with that and that the fix is more than trivial, I went ahead and released it. DJ, please review the change and let me know if you want me to back it out of rc2. +1

Bug.Summery: Ant editor doesn't recognize macrodefs with a uri
Bug.WithStack:
The Ant editor will pick up macrodefs and provide auto-completion of the macro (and jump to definition when requested) as expected if the macrodef has _no_ uri. Putting the macrodef in a namespace by setting the 'uri' attribute will break this behaviour (the actual build.xml runs ok in ant, its just the editor which fails to see the definition).
This behavior was found regardless of location of macrodef (ie, external file imported or inline in the build.xml).
--- Sample build.xml ---
<project name="test" default="run-macro" xmlns:xyz="http://xyz" >
<macrodef name="echo-macro" uri="http://xyz"> <attribute name="str"/> <sequential> <echo>@{str}</echo> </sequential> </macrodef>
<target name="run-macro" > <xyz:echo-macro str="Hello World"/> <!-- this doesn't auto-complete --> </target> </project> Investigating a solution to correctly lookup defined tasks/types in namespaces. Plan to fix for Rc2 We still have bug 99075....but much more works than it did.
Changes to: AntEditorCompletionProcessor: to correct "translate" elementnames to handle namespaces.
XMLTextHover: consider ':' to be part of tags
ProjectHelper: notify the AntModel of prefix to uri mappings
AntModel: cache the prefix to uri mappings and expose translation of element names to and from these mappings
Tests added to: AntEditorTests for the opening of declaration of namespaced node CodeCompletionTests for proposals for namespaced elements. Also fixed up so that the tests dispose the created ant models 98853.xml test file added.
Ben, any and all testing on this support would be greatly appreciated. Please verify Kevin (and Ben). verified
Bug.WithOutStack:
The Ant editor will pick up macrodefs and provide auto-completion of the macro (and jump to definition when requested) as expected if the macrodef has _no_ uri. Putting the macrodef in a namespace by setting the 'uri' attribute will break this behaviour (the actual build.xml runs ok in ant, its just the editor which fails to see the definition).
This behavior was found regardless of location of macrodef (ie, external file imported or inline in the build.xml).
--- Sample build.xml ---
<project name="test" default="run-macro" xmlns:xyz="http://xyz" >
<macrodef name="echo-macro" uri="http://xyz"> <attribute name="str"/> <sequential> <echo>@{str}</echo> </sequential> </macrodef>
<target name="run-macro" > <xyz:echo-macro str="Hello World"/> <!-- this doesn't auto-complete --> </target> </project> Investigating a solution to correctly lookup defined tasks/types in namespaces. Plan to fix for Rc2 We still have bug 99075....but much more works than it did.
Changes to: AntEditorCompletionProcessor: to correct "translate" elementnames to handle namespaces.
XMLTextHover: consider ':' to be part of tags
ProjectHelper: notify the AntModel of prefix to uri mappings
AntModel: cache the prefix to uri mappings and expose translation of element names to and from these mappings
Tests added to: AntEditorTests for the opening of declaration of namespaced node CodeCompletionTests for proposals for namespaced elements. Also fixed up so that the tests dispose the created ant models 98853.xml test file added.
Ben, any and all testing on this support would be greatly appreciated. Please verify Kevin (and Ben). verified

Bug.Summery: config.ini in local configuration is overwritten
Bug.WithStack:
n200506070010
When running with a shared (initialized) install, Update writes a new config.ini to the local configuration location pointing to the parent configuration (using the osgi.sharedConfiguration.area property).
This config.ini may already exist (the framework is able to load values from both). In that case, Update overwrites the existing one. It should just update it to have the osgi.sharedConfiguration.area property. I could provide a patch if one is requested. The config.ini is only writen when a valid platform.xml is not there. A simple fix would be to check for the existence of the file prior to writing:
File configIni = new File(newConfigIniURL.getFile()); if (configIni.exists()) return;
in the PlatformConfiguration.linkInitializedState(...) Is this what you had in mind? If not,please provide a patch. Thanks! I guess that would be enough (no need to update the existing file). I actually do not understand the scenario that requires Update to write a config.ini, since that value either is automatically determined, or is explicitly provided. this is more of a legacy thing, when config.ini was not even provided, and the configurator was generating it (even in regular, non-shared installs)
I can see situations in which config.ini would have to be generated by configurator, but I don't fully understand all the usages (and defaults) of config.ini.
So, please provide the patch that makes you the happiest and I will check it in. This was not deemed important due to the lack of use cases requiring a pre-existing local config.ini to be supported.
Once the config.ini is created, further changes made to it are not overriden.

Bug.Summery: Key modifier for certain functions varies on Mac

Lines.Line: 1) GEF uses Ctrl + Drag as cloning; Mac uses Alt + Drag.
2) Alt + Up/Down for traversing to parent/children; Mac uses Cmd + Up/Down.
3) Ctrl + Arrow for navigating to next work in the text example; Mac uses Alt
+ Arrow.
I've fixed case 1 above. Added MODIFIER_CLONE to DragEditPartsTracker and
MODIFIER_IGNORE_SNAP to AbstractTool (since it will be needed in CreationTool,
ConnectionBendpointTracker, etc. when they support snapping), which are
initialized to ALT and CTRL (respectively) if the OS is Mac (and vice versa if
it's not).

Bug.WithStack:
1) GEF uses Ctrl + Drag as cloning; Mac uses Alt + Drag. 2) Alt + Up/Down for traversing to parent/children; Mac uses Cmd + Up/Down. 3) Ctrl + Arrow for navigating to next work in the text example; Mac uses Alt + Arrow. I've fixed case 1 above. Added MODIFIER_CLONE to DragEditPartsTracker and MODIFIER_IGNORE_SNAP to AbstractTool (since it will be needed in CreationTool, ConnectionBendpointTracker, etc. when they support snapping), which are initialized to ALT and CTRL (respectively) if the OS is Mac (and vice versa if it's not).
Randy, Ctrl for not snapping on Mac is fine, right? Randy, do we want to fix case 2 or 3 (3 is in the text example, so not as important)? If not, I can mark this bug as fixed. We can not fix case 2 right now. It is too risky to use Command key. For 3), there are lots of differences in our example, but it is just an example so post 3.1. Marking this as fixed. Case 2 to be considered post-3.1. I'll open another bug report for that.

Added MODIFIER_CLONE to DragEditPartsTracker and MODIFIER_IGNORE_SNAP to AbstractTool (since it will be needed in CreationTool, ConnectionBendpointTracker, etc. when they support snapping), which are initialized to ALT and CTRL (respectively) if the OS is Mac (and vice versa if it's not).

Case 2 to be considered post-3.1. I'll open another bug report for that.

Bug.Summery: JUnit test hangs when run it via the Run->Test context menu selection in the Test Navigator view

Lines.Line: 1. created a Java project (NumbersProj) and then after this switched to a Test
perspective
2. created a folder in this project (junittests)
3. imported a zip file into this project (see attachment)
4. created a junit test suite in the junittests folder
(GaussianIntegerRandomNumberTest) by selecting
File->New-Other->Test Suite->JUnit Test Suite Definition
5. created a junit testcase in this test suite (selected
GaussianIntegerRandomNumberTest from the
Test Navigator view and then New->Test Artifact from its context menu.
Selected Test->Test
Elements->Test Case. Specified JUnit Test Method and a name of
testGenerateNumber).
6. from the JUnit test suite editor, verified testGenerateNumber appeared as a
test method
7. from the Behavior page of the test suite editor, specified an invocation for
testGenerateNumber
8. closed the test suite, saving the changes made
9. from the Test Navigator view, selected GaussianIntegerRandomNumberTest and
then Generate...
from its context menu
10. used browse button to select NumbersProj as the Java project (Source folder
became disabled/grey)
11. from a Package Explorer view, double-clicked on
GaussianIntegerRandomNumberTest.java to open
it
12. typed the following in for the body of the testgeneratenumber() method:
GaussianIntegerRandomGenerator randomGenerator = new
13. closed the test file, saving the changes made
14. from the Test Navigator view, selected GaussianRandomNumberTest and then
Run->Test from
its context menu

Bug.WithStack:
The version of RAD I'm using has IES 3.0.3: 200505201648.
STEPS: 1. created a Java project (NumbersProj) and then after this switched to a Test perspective 2. created a folder in this project (junittests) 3. imported a zip file into this project (see attachment) 4. created a junit test suite in the junittests folder (GaussianIntegerRandomNumberTest) by selecting File->New-Other->Test Suite->JUnit Test Suite Definition 5. created a junit testcase in this test suite (selected GaussianIntegerRandomNumberTest from the Test Navigator view and then New->Test Artifact from its context menu. Selected Test->Test Elements->Test Case. Specified JUnit Test Method and a name of testGenerateNumber). 6. from the JUnit test suite editor, verified testGenerateNumber appeared as a test method 7. from the Behavior page of the test suite editor, specified an invocation for testGenerateNumber 8. closed the test suite, saving the changes made 9. from the Test Navigator view, selected GaussianIntegerRandomNumberTest and then Generate... from its context menu 10. used browse button to select NumbersProj as the Java project (Source folder became disabled/grey) 11. from a Package Explorer view, double-clicked on GaussianIntegerRandomNumberTest.java to open it 12. typed the following in for the body of the testgeneratenumber() method: GaussianIntegerRandomGenerator randomGenerator = new GaussianIntegerRandomGenerator(); randomGenerator.reset(); randomeGenerator.setMinMax(1,3); int randomNum = randomeGenerator.generateNumber(); assertTture(randomNum > 1 && randomNum < 3); 13. closed the test file, saving the changes made 14. from the Test Navigator view, selected GaussianRandomNumberTest and then Run->Test from its context menu
RESULT: An hour glass appears when the mouse is in the Test Navigator view and never disappears. No progress indicator appears in the lower right to indicate it's doing anything. The Task Manager shows the RAD IDE as not responding. It's was hung for at least 5 minutes, so I killed it.
NOTE: someone on our PVT test team reported a Core Exception when last attempting this scenario (RATLC01085978), but I don't get any core exception and no .log file exists.
I did play around with this more and found some workarounds. That is, after I killed RAD from the Task Manager and restarted it, I then selected the Test in the Test Navigator view but this time selected Run->Run. The Run window appeared and Generated Configuration appeared open. This configuration was listed under the Test category in the Configurations list on the left and must have been created by the tooling when I had selected Run->Test. It showed GaussianIntegerRandomeNumberTest as the test to run and local_deployment as the selected deployment. What I did is create a JUnit configuration that referenced the same test class and ran that from the Run window and it ran successfully. I then opened the Generated Configuration again and selected the Run button in the Run window and was surprised that that was successful (it didn't hang). So, I then went back to the Test Navigator view and tried selecting the test and then Run->Test and again it hung. Created attachment 22578 testcase Upgrading to P1 as per Steve Francisco's request. This flow doesn't appear in our test cases (though we'll add it.) My understand from Kathy Endres is that this test case has never passed (was just recently added to their test case.) I am able to reproduce this in 3.3, and also in 3.2. The fact that we hang is obviously a big problem, so we should consider fixing it in 3.3, but the fact that the problem has been there since 3.2 (and likely since the shortcut was first put in place) without anyone reporting it is also worth considering.
The hang is caused by a syncExec() call in the org.eclipse.hyades.ui.internal.provider.ResourceChangeUpdaterProvider.doProcess Delta(IResourceDelta) method. syncExec is a notorious cause of deadlocks, and its use is stringly discouraged by Eclipse. I am surprised to see this call appearing in a frequently used class such as ResourceChangeUpdaterProvider. Changing the call to asyncExec() fixes this problem, but obviously introduces some delay between the time the listener is notified and the time the notification's results are displayed.
This class is used by the TestNavigator, LogNavigator and LogNavigatorSynchronizer, so making the change could cause problems in other components. The hand is likley caused by the launch configuration code holding a lock when the launch in invoked. It's also possible that we could address this problem by changing the run shortcut code to launch the test using a different mechanism (when you launch the test from the launch configuration dialog directly, the code path is different, which likely explains why this is only hit when running the tes from the shortcut.)
I'd like to understand if this is something that we want to hold 3.3. up for, and if so, we need to discuss the asyncExec call with the other consumers or investigate an alternat way of launching the test from the shortcut (which I expect can be done b/c we have products that support this.) Looking at CVS, this feature has been here since 3.0. I find it hard to believe that it has never worked, but the problem appears in 3.2 and 3.3 at least.
Reassigning to Julien. I am not sure what changed to cause this hang to occur -- can you please take a look at this and suggest what could be done to safely fix it in 3.3? The difference between launching a test using the shorcut and launching the same test using the launch configuration dialog is that the shorcut launch occurs in the UI thread, whereas the launch config launch occurs in Eclipse "launch" job.
So, I have modified the launch shorcut code to leverage Eclipse API for launching the test using the same job as the launch configuration does. The change consists in replacing: DebugUITools.saveAndBuildBeforeLaunch(); lconfig.launch(mode, new NullProgressMonitor()); with: DebugUIPlugin.launchInBackground(lconfig, mode);
This same modification was made in the 4.0 branch a few months ago (as an enhancement), so this fix sounds to me not only safe, but even an improvement.
However, even if this change fixes this specific problem, I think we may still have a problem because of this syncExec() call in the method org.eclipse.hyades.ui.internal.provider.ResourceChangeUpdaterProvider.doProcess Delta(IResourceDelta) mentionned by Joe. But replacing syncExec() with asyncExec() at this stage of the 3.3 release life sounds risky, as this ResourceChangeUpdaterProvider is invoking listeners both in TPTP and TPTP consumers. How about making it only in 4.0, provided that 4.0 has still a few weeks of testing ahead? House keeping. As of TPTP 4.6.0, TPTP is in maintenance mode and focusing on improving quality by resolving relevant enhancements/defects and increasing test coverage through test creation, automation, Build Verification Tests (BVTs), and expanded run-time execution. As part of the TPTP Bugzilla housecleaning process (see http://wiki.eclipse.org/Bugzilla_Housecleaning_Processes), this enhancement/defect is verified/closed by the Project Lead since this enhancement/defect has been resolved and unverified for more than 1 year and considered to be fixed. If this enhancement/defect is still unresolved and reproducible in the latest TPTP release (http://www.eclipse.org/tptp/home/downloads/), please re-open.
