Bug.WithStack:
N20050608-gtk
The new transparent icons are not correctly handled on the Linux-GTK platform. The icons in the task bar and the task switcher (Alt+TAB) are not rendered with transparency. Will attach a screenshot. Created attachment 22593 transparent.png
Screenshot of my task switcher.
The currently selected window is the Gimp window for the eclipse48.png file showing correct transparency - so it is possible to get it right.
To its right is the icon for the eclipse window. Note the white and black borders to to converted transparency areas.
Feels at least major for me as shipping this looks really bad. This should probably go to SWT. mvm: which file is being used on GTK+? Is it the .ico or the .png files? As of last night 2005 06 08 should be ICO files everywhere but the Mac. I understood from SN that this was supported. The problem is that ICO files with alpha are only supported on XP and GTK (and we have a bug that is preventing GTK from working). The GTK bug may be fixed after RC2. We are working to solve the general problem for Eclipse by making Shell.setImages() smarter for RC2. Stand by. *** Bug 98985 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** *** Bug 98933 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** This bug has been used to track the badness of the icons in the Eclipse window which was solved by making Shell.setImages() smarter. I have opened bug 99253 about the specific issue of ico files with alpha on GTK+. This was fixed by SN and SSQ for the 4pm build today. If this bug is tracking the recent icon cheeze, then this is still a problem on windows XP in RC3.
The icon in the window title is fixed, but the icon on the task bar is still badly stretched. Isn't "cheeze" is spelled "cheese". Anyhow, can you attach a screen shot of the badness? Stefan, gotta see the badness in XP in RC3 before proceeding because this WORKSFORME. Got a gif? Somehow, Shell.setImages() was not fixed for the Mac. The other problems have been fixed. The cheeze I'm seeing seems to only occur with 16-bit colour and the 120-DPI (large size) setting.
Created attachment 24055 screenshot of bad icon
I20050627-1435 Windows XP 120 DPI (large size)
Primary monitor 1600x1200x16, 85 hz ATI 3D rage pro (PCI)
Secondary monitor 1600x1200x16, 75 hz NVIDIA Vanta (AGP)
I've reproduced on a MvM's machine, although the cheeze was different. Seems to be the combination of 120DPI and 16-bit colour that does it. The cheeze seems to depend on the colour depth of the windows primary monitor, not the monitor containing the start bar.
If I make my AGP card into the primary display (through windows - not the bios) and change its colour depth to 32, the problem goes away on both monitors. when I increase the DPI setting for my graphics card on my laptop to 120 I see this behaviour as well. Shell.setImages() has been fixed on the Mac. Is this now fixed? Yes, it was fixed on the Mac.

Bug.Summery: Report Preview: Cannot load JDBC Driver class
Bug.WithStack:
I've defined a new JDBC Driver for SQL Server, and created a DataSource from it. The data preview works fine while creating/editing the datasource.
I then create a table in my empty report by dragging the datasource into the editor.
Then I switch to the Preview tab, and after a few seconds an error is displayed: -- There are errors on the report page:Error1:No se puede abrir la conexiуn del controlador (org.eclipse.birt.report.data.oda.jdbc).Cannot load JDBC Driver class: [com.microsoft.jdbc.sqlserver.SQLServerDriver]. Cannot load JDBC Driver class: [com.microsoft.jdbc.sqlserver.SQLServerDriver]. --
It seems like the required jars are not included in the classpath for the report editor...
I've installed BIRT in a new "site", instead of copying it directly over my eclipse instalation. The most likely cause is that the JDBC driver has not been installed in the viewer plugin directory. Check the following directory. Do you see your JDBC driver there? If not you will need to manually copy that driver's JAR files to this location for report preview to work:
\eclipse\plugins\org.eclipse.birt.report.viewer_1.0.0\birt\WEB-INF\plugins\org.eclipse.birt.report.data.oda.jdbc\drivers
That was the cause (missing drivers).
However, it is quite confusing as I've been able to select JARs from anywhere while creating the datasource, and I have already been able to see the data in the preview.
I think a tighter integration between components of BIRT is a must (at the very least, automatically copy the JAR files selected while creating the datasource into that folder).
Is this being worked on? (I find no relevant bug report). How did you initially add your JDBC driver to BIRT? Did you use the "Manage Drivers" wizard (accessed from the button with the same name in the New Data Source dialog for JDBC data sources)? This wizard is supposed to take care of this for you - it should have copied the JAR files to all necessary locations. Yes, I used the wizard.
I'm using a different site for installing BIRT as described, for instance, on http://www.javalobby.org/java/forums/t18678.html (i.e. I've not copied it over my eclipse installation).
That might be the reason why the jar files have not been copied to the right location (which seems to be the BIRT site, not the Eclipse main installation).
The folder does not exist on my Eclipse installation, it has not been created and it has not reported an error, or I don't rememeber it... I'll check again and report here. There are 3 *.jar files with com.microsoft.jdbc.sqlserver.If you use wizard to add the jdbc drivers, you must add all of them. If You cannot find the copy of these jar files in \eclipse\plugins\org.eclipse.birt.report.viewer_1.0.0 \birt\WEB-INF\plugins\org.eclipse.birt.report.data.oda.jdbc\drivers, You can manually copy them under this file. This can make the preview work. If there still has this problem , please reopen this bug.
Vierified in the Build 20051220

Bug.Summery: Team contribution in context menu is not available if workingset is selected

Lines.Line: - Have a Java working set in the package explorer, containing the following 4
projects:
- org.eclipse.ltk.core.refactoring (imported, binary, linked)
- org.eclipse.ltk.core.refactoring.tests (source, shared)
- org.eclipse.ltk.ui.refactoring (imported, binary, linked)
- org.eclipse.ltk.ui.refactoring.tests (source, shared)

Bug.WithStack:
N20050606-0010
Steps to reproduce: - Have a Java working set in the package explorer, containing the following 4 projects: - org.eclipse.ltk.core.refactoring (imported, binary, linked) - org.eclipse.ltk.core.refactoring.tests (source, shared) - org.eclipse.ltk.ui.refactoring (imported, binary, linked) - org.eclipse.ltk.ui.refactoring.tests (source, shared)
When selecting the working set and invoking the context menu, all team contributions are missing
-> Team contributions should be available for heterogeneous selections as well. The best we can do here is to have Team operations when the selection contains some shared with the same repository type (CVS in this case) and others not shared at all. This already supported.
The reason for this is that, if there is two repositories involved, the Team menu will contain the commands from two repository types. The bad news is that PDE uses a repository provider for binary projects so the CVS operations do not appear for you.
Bug.WithOutStack:
N20050606-0010
Steps to reproduce: - Have a Java working set in the package explorer, containing the following 4 projects: - org.eclipse.ltk.core.refactoring (imported, binary, linked) - org.eclipse.ltk.core.refactoring.tests (source, shared) - org.eclipse.ltk.ui.refactoring (imported, binary, linked) - org.eclipse.ltk.ui.refactoring.tests (source, shared)
When selecting the working set and invoking the context menu, all team contributions are missing
-> Team contributions should be available for heterogeneous selections as well. The best we can do here is to have Team operations when the selection contains some shared with the same repository type (CVS in this case) and others not shared at all. This already supported.
The reason for this is that, if there is two repositories involved, the Team menu will contain the commands from two repository types. The bad news is that PDE uses a repository provider for binary projects so the CVS operations do not appear for you.

Bug.Summery: [Progress] Synchronize result remains unfinished in progress view

Lines.Line: 1. "Synchronize" with CVS repository. In "progress view" the result shows
"finished".
2. Close "progress view".
3. Open "progress view".
4. The result is changed to "unfinished" in "progress view".

Bug.WithStack:
Eclipse 3.1RC1 (It happens also in Eclipse 3.0.2)
After synchronizing with CVS, the result remains in progress view. It shows "finished". But after closing progress view and opening it again, the result is changed to "unfinished". The progress indicator stops in 75% and "Cancel Task" button appears instead of "Remove Task". The result cannot be removed by "Remove All Finised Tasks". Created attachment 22594 Image of "progress view"
The several results remains unfinised. Do they remain unfinished indefinitely or do they eventually finish (i.e. if you look at the view 1 hour later are they still unfinished)? They seem to remain indefinitely. I've waited for 1 hour. But they remain "unfinished" in progress view.
The operation is as following. 1. "Synchronize" with CVS repository. In "progress view" the result shows "finished". 2. Close "progress view". 3. Open "progress view". 4. The result is changed to "unfinished" in "progress view".
Do you reproduce it? I've seen it occasionally as well. One case I have seen involves a case where the synchronize view takes a long time to update after the remote part of the synchronize is finished. In this case the entry in the Progress view does eventually finish. It is possible that, in your case, the Progress view has a stale entry that it is showing. I believe that work is planned for 3.2 in this area. *** Bug 99711 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** *** Bug 101597 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** happens on linux as well - some empowered usesr please update the OS field I have it also often, happening about every third time I'm doing a CVS synchronize.
Eclipse 3.1.0 (I20050627-1435), Windows XP.
I can confirm that this is still a problem with 3.1.2 M20060118-1600 on Windows XP SP2. See attached screen shot. Created attachment 57423 Screeen shot From the screen shots, this appears to be an issue with the Progress view (i.e. entries are being duplicated and left around). I agree. Running it through the debugger confirms that all worker threads are idle, so it's not actually doing anything. This was fixed in 3.3
Bug.WithOutStack:
Eclipse 3.1RC1 (It happens also in Eclipse 3.0.2)
After synchronizing with CVS, the result remains in progress view. It shows "finished". But after closing progress view and opening it again, the result is changed to "unfinished". The progress indicator stops in 75% and "Cancel Task" button appears instead of "Remove Task". The result cannot be removed by "Remove All Finised Tasks". Created attachment 22594 Image of "progress view"
The several results remains unfinised. Do they remain unfinished indefinitely or do they eventually finish (i.e. if you look at the view 1 hour later are they still unfinished)? They seem to remain indefinitely. I've waited for 1 hour. But they remain "unfinished" in progress view.
The operation is as following. 1. "Synchronize" with CVS repository. In "progress view" the result shows "finished". 2. Close "progress view". 3. Open "progress view". 4. The result is changed to "unfinished" in "progress view".
Do you reproduce it? I've seen it occasionally as well. I believe that work is planned for 3.2 in this area. *** Bug 99711 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** *** Bug 101597 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** happens on linux as well - some empowered usesr please update the OS field I have it also often, happening about every third time I'm doing a CVS synchronize.

Bug.Summery: Formatter, which would consider the manually wrapped lines
Bug.WithStack:
The current formatter line wrapping doesn't do what my "non-using eclipse" co-workers expect :) For example, they prefer to have operators like "+" to be located before an expression wrapping, rather than at the beginning of the next line. If I disable all the wrappings options (for all elements), and if I wrap manually the lines, then after a format, Eclipse automatically merges the manually wrapped lines... The formatter is a nice feature and it's useful apart from wrapping. What I suggest, is an option in the formatter, which would let the user works with it: the formatter would only format the lines (with contents) that are given (or already wrapped by the users). It can wrap if needed, but cannot merge lines.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 91902 *** This request exactly matches the 'Never Join Lines' preferences introduced in 3.5 version, hence change the duplicate...
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 198074 *** Verified for 3.6M6
Bug.WithOutStack:

Bug.Summery: Console hyperlinks inaccurately detected
